From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2021 film directed by Devanshu Singh


14 PhereRelease posterDirected byDevanshu SinghWritten byManoj KalwaniProduced byZee StudiosStarringVikrant MasseyKriti KharbandaCinematographyRiju DasEdited byManan Ajay SagarMusic byRaajeev V. BhallaJAM8ProductioncompanyZee StudiosDistributed byZEE5Release date
23 July 2021 (2021-07-23)
Running time111 minutesCountryIndiaLanguageHindi
14 Phere (transl. 14 rounds)[a] is a 2021 Indian Hindi-language social comedy film directed by Devanshu Singh and produced by Zee Studios. The film stars Vikrant Massey and Kriti Kharbanda.[1][2] It premiered on 23 July 2021 on ZEE5.[3]


Plot[edit]
Sanjay Lal Singh and Aditi Karwasra, two individuals belonging to different castes, fall in love and wish to get married. However, knowing their parents will disapprove, they hatch a plan to convince them.

Cast[edit]
Vikrant Massey as Sanjay Lal Singh a.k.a. Sanju
Kriti Kharbanda as Aditi Karwasra
Gauahar Khan as Zubina
Jameel Khan as Amay
Yamini Das as Sarla Lal Singh
Vineet Kumar as Kanhaiya Lal Singh
Priyanshu Singh as Chhotu Singh
Manoj Bakshi as Banwari Mama
Govind Pandey as Dharampal Karwasra
Sumit Suri as Vivek Karwasra
Sonakshi Batra as Sneha Karwasra
Bhupesh Singh as Jayant Mishra
Kritika Pande as Rashmi
Geet Sagar as Anuj Mathur (Aditi and Sanjay's Boss)
Shivani Shivpuri as Mrs Gupta
Production[edit]
Principal photography commenced on 26 November 2020 in Mumbai,[4][5] and was wrapped up in January 2021.[citation needed]

Reception[edit]
Shubhra Gupta of The Indian Express gave the film 1.5 out of 5 stars and stated, "Between the long-drawn, wholly preposterous idea of fake ‘baraatis’, and two ‘shaadis’, there's just confusion in this Vikrant Massey-Kriti Kharbanda film."[6] Saibal Chatterjee of NDTV gave the film 1.5 out of 5 stars and stated, "Notwithstanding the serviceable chemistry between the lead actors and a few performances from the supporting cast, the film goes around in circles."[7] Rahul Desai of Film Companion gave the film a negative review and stated that the film "loses its spirit and identity" and is "half-funny, half-serious And fully confused".[8] Stutee Ghosh of The Quint gave the film a mixed review and stated, "Given that the humour is pretty flat, the narrative would have benefited with some intense emotional moments and by showing some spine and vision. It almost feels like the message is that as long as one can show off an ostentatious display of wealth and dowry, one can hush up about caste- a rather problematic resolution!"[9] Anita Aikara of Rediff.com gave the film 2.5 out of 5 stars and stated, "14 Phere delivers on the feel-good factor, but if you are looking for ground-breaking humour, it will fail to work its way into your hearts."[10] Nandini Ramnath of Scroll gave the film a negative review and criticized the screenplay, performance, the leads, but praised Jameel Khan's performance.[11]

Soundtrack[edit]
14 PhereSoundtrack album by Raajeev V. Bhalla and JAM8Released20 July 2021[12]Recorded2020GenreFeature film soundtrackLength27:46LanguageHindiLabelZee Music CompanyOfficial audio14 Phere – Full Album on YouTube

The music of film was composed by Rajeev V Bhalla and JAM8 while lyrics written by Rajeev. V. Bhalla, Pallavi Mahajan, Geet Sagar and Shloke Lal.

See also[edit]
Saat phere (seven rounds)
Saptapadi (seven steps)
Notes[edit]


^ The title is a play on the "saat phere" wedding ritual.
